content: If there are no objections, I'd like to add cover art to this puzzle.

I like this mid-level puzzle. I tried to straighten up the text description a bit and added an additional tag.
Please feel free to make / add other amendments.
Shouldn't validator 1 be different from test case 1?

Big fan of what you did here!  While I agree with the other comments regarding the initial "OMG" reaction to the wall-of-text explanation, I don't think it's a problem nor something that needs changing.

99.9% of everyone who will attempt this puzzle will be completely familiar with the concept of toppling dominoes (probably with first-hand experience, too).  The rules for how the dominoes interact are incredibly intuitive, as is the ASCII representation of their angle. 
 Very early into reading the explanation I realized where this challenge was heading, and sped-read the remaining 4/5ths just nodding and thinking "yep.  yep. 
 sounds right.  makes sense."  I'm sure most everyone else will have the same experience.

It's a programming challenge you can quickly understand, offers plenty of creative freedom in how you choose to solve it, and has that nice balance of "complex-but-not-confusing".
9 outta 10.  Love it.  Gets my approval & upvote!


P.S.:  Lot's of potential for variations/"sequels" with this puzzle.  e.g.: display the map after x dominoes have fallen, determine the minimum number of dominoes to rotate in order to leave zero standing, add a ball ('o')  which "rolls" in the direction it was hit until it hits something, etc.
I like the puzzle idea, but this wall of text is scary. The example explanation helps but isn't very clear. I was able to follow because I understood intuitively how the dominos would fall.
A bold attempt to try drawing domino by ascii art but the resulting drawing does not look intuitive to me, making it much less interesting than what it supposed to be.
Maybe it would help to replace I with | and O with . or space

I like this puzzle too ! Maybe could someone good at english langage read it and correct some typoes ?
This puzzle is nice idea !

Because Test case 1 is already shown, it doesn't really matter in my opinion. But it can be changed.
Thanks for the ideas.

Photo by Escalhuda under CC SA 3.0
https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/3.0/deed.en
Thanks for replying. I changed it a bit.
As soon as description cleared and english corrected, I validate. I like this puzzle much !
This indeed needs a lot of small corrections. I would also recommend to remove "\" and "/" from the name.
